frontmatter.title: LTE: why are high frequencies faster than low frequencies?
frontmatter.description: While theoretical speed on different frequencies are identical on LTE, this is very rarely the case in the real world. Why is that?

frontmatter.title: Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing (OFDM), Subcarriers, Resource Blocks and more in 4G and 5G
frontmatter.description: OFDM allows multiple subcarriers within resource blocks to overlap significantly while producing little to no interference, allowing 5G to use its frequency allocation far more effectively.

frontmatter.title: Phone mast sectorisation and mast deployment patterns
frontmatter.description: To provide mobile coverage to a large area, masts need to be deployed in sectors. This article provides an overview of the sectorisation process and the deployment patterns.

nodes.excerpt: Modern cell sites cover a surprisingly large area, often providing signal to 2 km² or more. However, an individual mast panel is not capable…

frontmatter.title: LTE frequency bands and duplex modes
frontmatter.description: LTE functions on a wide range of frequencies called "bands", and are standardised across the world. These bands can operate in one of two duplexing modes, explained in this article.

frontmatter.title: Introduction to 4G/LTE and carrier aggregation.
frontmatter.description: 4G and LTE are terms that are often use interchangeably, but there are some significant differences between them.
